Problem:
Consider a system governed by a second order linear partial differential equation \\( u_{tt} = c^2 \\Delta u \\), where \\( c \\) is a constant representing the speed of sound. We explore the influence of applying an initial displacement by a function \\( h(x) \\), where \\( x \\) denotes spatial coordinates.

If at time \\( t_1 \\), before reaching T, an additional displacement function \\( j(x) \\) is applied as an intervention affecting the system's state, will the displacement \\( u(x, t) \\) at T rely solely on the initial function \\( h(x) \\) and not on intervention \\( j(x) \\)?
Explanation: The intervention by applying \\( j(x) \\) at time \\( t_1 \\) modifies the initial conditions and thus affects the subsequent evolution of the displacement according to the wave equation. As a result, the displacement at time T will depend both on \\( h(x) \\) and \\( j(x) \\).
